problem:
\begin{problem*}{}{}
Find all polynomials $P(x)$ with degree 
  $\leq n$ and non-negative coefficients such that
  \[
    P(x)P \left( \frac{1}{x} \right) \leq P(1)^2
  \]
  for all positive $x$. Here $n$ is a natural number.
\end{problem*}
solution:
\begin{soln}
  Let $P(x) = a_{0}+a_{1}x^{1}+\dots+a_{n}x^{n}$. Then for all
  $x>0$, by Cauchyâ€“Schwarz inequality, we get
  \begin{align*}
    P(x)P\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)
    &= ((\sqrt{a_{0}})^2+\dots+(\sqrt{a_{n}x^{n}})^2)
    ((\sqrt{a_0})^2+\dots +(\sqrt{a_{n}/ x^{n}})^2) \\
    &\ge (a_0+\dots +a_{n})^2=P(1)^2
  .\end{align*}
  \[\]
  Thus the equality holds which forces the equality in
  CS, i.e.,
  \[
    \frac{\sqrt{a_0}}{\sqrt{a_0}}=\dots
    =\frac{\sqrt{a_{n}x^{n}}}{\sqrt{\frac{a_{n}}{x^{n}}}},
  \]
  which implies $x^{n}=x^{n-1}=\dots=1$ which is absurd
  unless $n=1$. Therefore $P(x)$ must be a constant polynomial
  and it is easy to see that all $P(x)\equiv c$, $c \ge 0$,
  work.
\end{soln}
